alert.note: Alert for Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Raleigh (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:31AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Raleigh and Fayette Counties through 815 AM EDT... At 730 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Burnwell, or 12 miles west of Fayetteville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Babcock State Park, Oak Hill, Mount Hope, Bradley, Piney View, Powellton, Meadow Bridge, Pax, Thurmond and Artie. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 52 and 67. Route 19 between mile markers 3 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
